IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION IS CONCERNED WITH THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN IN MIND AND BODY IN NONTRADITIONAL FORMATS AS WELL AS AN APPRECIATION FOR NATURE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A PRIVATE COED BOARDING SCHOOL FOR GRADES 4 THROUGH 9 WITH THE STUDENTS RESIDING IN FAMILY LIKE GROUPS AS WELL AS A SUMMER CAMP PROGRAM, BOTH GROUPS LEARNING A RESPECT FOR THE ENVIRONMENT AND THE BALANCE OF NATURE THROUGH THE ORGANIC FARM ON PREMISES AND THE CARE OF LIVESTOCK.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE EDUCATION AND LEARNING AT A PRIVATE SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY SETTING. INCLUDES SCHOOL AND SUMMER PROGRAMS. APPROXIMATELY 217 PEOPLE SERVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS A PRACTICE OF DISTRIBUTING 4-5% OF A THREE YEAR ROLLING AVERAGE OF THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF THE PORTFOLIO TO SUPPORT GENERAL OPERATIONS OF THE SCHOOL. THE REMAINING FUNDS ARE HELD IN PERPETUITY OR FOR A DONOR SPECIFIED PERIOD OF TIME AND WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING TO SCHOOL PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE ENDOWMENT.

THE SCHOOL HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION AND IS TAX EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE.Under Accounting Standards Codification (ASC Topic 740) the tax status of tax-exempt entities is an uncertain tax position, since events could potentially occur that jeopardize their tax-exempt status. Management is not aware of any events that could jeopardize the Schools tax exempt status. Therefore, no liability or provision for income tax has been reflected in the financial statements. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2013.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: fundraising expense netted with revenue $8048 change in value of pooled income fund $-3399

Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL ADMISSION MATERIAL BOTH IN PRINT AND ON THE WEBSITE INCLUDE A STATEMENT OF THE SCHOOL AND CAMP'S RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: NORTH COUNTRY SCHOOL AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AND CAMPERS BASED ON DEMONSTRATION OF FINANCIAL NEED. SCHOOL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF THE RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO THE STUDENT. FAMILIES MUST COMPLETE AN APPLICATION WITH SSS, A NATIONAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION PROCESS USED BY MOST INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS. CAMP SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF THE RESOURCES AVAILABLE AS DETERMINED BY REVIEW OF THE FAMILIES' TAX RETURN INFORMATION AND THE COMPLETION OF A FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Part I, Line 32, Hire and Use of Third Parties
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Development has utilized a phone bank for annual fund raising.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE 990 with senior MANAGEMENT prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT IS REVIEWED AND SIGNED ANNUALLY BY EACH OFFICER, DIRECTOR, AND TRUSTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPARABILITY OF DATA FROM PEER SCHOOLS REGARDING COMPENSATION OF THE HEADMASTER AND ALL OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES IS COLLECTED THROUGH INDEPENDENT SOURCES. THE HEADMASTER'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD CHAIR AND ONE OR MORE OTHER INDEPENDENT TRUSTEES SELECTED BY THE BOARD CHAIR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: this process has not changed from the prior year.
